metadata.Title: CVE-2020-10749 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.Description: A vulnerability was found in all versions of containernetworking/plugins before version 0.8.6, that allows malicious containers in Kubernetes clusters to perform man-in-the-middle (MitM) attacks. A malicious container can exploit this flaw by sending rogue IPv6 router advertisements to the host or other containers, to redirect traffic to the malicious container.

criterions.comment: golang-github-containernetworking-plugins package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.8.6-1').
